<<<api>>>: Collections.max
<<<code>>>: Map.Entry<K, V> maxEntry = null;
for (Map.Entry<K, V> entry : map.entrySet()) {
    if (maxEntry == null || entry.getValue().compareTo(maxEntry.getValue()) > 0) {
        maxEntry = entry;
    }
}
K key = maxEntry.getKey();
<<<explanation>>>: You can iterate over the map entries and keep track of the entry with the maximum value.

<<<api>>>: Collections.max
<<<code>>>: Map.Entry<K, V> maxEntry = null;

<<<api>>>: Map.Entry
<<<code>>>: Map.Entry<K, V> maxEntry = null;
for (Map.Entry<K, V> entry : map.entrySet()) {
    if (maxEntry == null || entry.getValue().compareTo(maxEntry.getValue()) > 0) {
        maxEntry = entry;
    }
}
K key = maxEntry.getKey();
<<<explanation>>>: To find the key associated with the max value in a map, you can iterate over the entries of the map using a for-each loop. Initialize a variable maxEntry to null. Then, for each entry in the map, compare the value of the entry with the value of maxEntry. If the value of the entry is greater than the value of maxEntry, update maxEntry to the current entry. Finally, retrieve the key associated with the max value using maxEntry.getKey().
